runs.comm: slightly back of a length, heading towards leg stump and nudged away square for one
length, sliding down the leg side and <del>Chris Gayle</del> Lendl Simmons watches it behind his derriere
angled in, shortish and dabbed down to the leg side
length delivery in the channel, nicely driven on the up but picks out the man at point
bumper, gets big on Simmons, whose pull shot comes off the top edge, sails safely over backward square and the man on the rope comes in to collect
back of a length and around off stump, Simmons presents a straight bat, rolls short on the off side
quick and straight to begin with, sliding on to the pads, deflects behind square
fired down the leg side
first boundary, just an uppish push from Simmons to a half-volley, there was a call of "catch!" but it comfortably cleared the ring and had the legs to get to the rope
length ball, sliding to leg again
sharp pace, rising from back of a length outside off, jabs at it
what a shot! Length ball from de Lange, maybe a fraction short, Simmons times it like a sweet shop and takes candy over deep midwicket. Went like a rocket
banged in, this is up above 145kph and beats the bat, Simmons takes it on the bonce and the ball bounces towards fine leg
gets on the front foot and pushes a single through mid-off
excellent line, this rises in the channel and past the bat as Smith drops his hands
goodish length on off stump, Smith closes the bat face and whips through square leg
gets away with this, Simmons coming early down the wicket and top-edging a swipe across the line, lands between three men converging towards backward point
good bumper, goes across and misses with a pull
backs away outside leg stump, 137kph from Abbott, good length in the channel, swing and a miss
short and rising at the body, Simmons rides the bounce and pushes into the covers
over the wicket, short and slightly leg side, Simmons pulls and misses, seemed early on it... Van Wyk appeals but the umpire only signals a wide
short and on the hips, flicked away past the diving short fine leg and that will be four more
skips down the track again, dug in short and the ball comes off the splice, pulled to short midwicket
Parnell goes full but misses his length, it's right in the slot as Simmons rocks back and bombards the crowd at long-on! Gayle won't have minded the look of that, too
short ball, goes right back to pull, powerfully struck and it bisects square leg and the man fine on the boundary, another boundary
four more, this time steered past short third man! Slower ball from Parnell, Simmons was back and waiting, opened the face and squirted the ball away
and again, pulled fine, more damage sustained! Short again from Parnell, again Simmons is waiting and he swivels to cart this past fine leg
short and Smith takes it on the body trying to pull
back of a length, tries to punch off the back foot, dribbles towards mid-off and they jog one
in the channel outside off, goes across and runs the ball down to third man
banged in and climbing down the leg side... Smith looks imploringly for the wide
continues to beat the middle of the pitch, worked off the body for a single towards midwicket
short and quick, beats Simmons inside edge as he tries to play across the line - good effort from de Lange after the previous over
tossed up, bowled him, leg stump pegged back! Smith just seemed to miss a straight one, didn't move the feet and tried to lump Phangiso out the park... skids through and SA have their first wicket
short and a touch wide, Samuels seizes on it first ball and slaps four through backward point
tighter line, leans out and defends back down the track
length, in the channel, Samuels goes back and steers towards point
gives this a bit more air, Samuels wanders out and whips through midwicket
down the leg side, Simmons only has to help it on its way, Phanghiso lets out a scream of frustration and the batsman tucks it for four
fullish outside off, maybe a slower ball, driven square to point
stays back and pushes into the off side, picks a gap
touch short, coming back in from outside off, mistimed a drive back to the bowler - a cutter from Wiese
backs away, Wiese sends a slower ball down wide of the stumps... called wide
on the stumps, Simmons turns this through midwicket for a single
quicker and outside off, slightly back of a length and Samuels throws his hands at it, fails to connect

cutter, coming back at Samuels, who steers the ball straight to point! Wiese charges off in celebration, that's a big wicket and an excellent over. Samuels tried to make room to go inside out but mistimed the shot, a thickish outside edge flew to Ontong on the edge of the ring
flighted, straightening a touch on middle and leg, hits Simmons on the front pad
drops back, little bit of width on offer from Phangiso, back cuts a couple behind square
Simmons comes dancing down the pitch, aiming towards cow corner, skids on and hits the pad, rolls towards gully
tossed up, comes forward and hits aerially through mid-off
full on off, blocked back to the bowler
floated up, comes forward and taps one more into the covers
length ball, taking the pace off and angled in towards the batsman, worked away to leg
Simmons attacks, swinging hard across the line, gets a couple towards deep midwicket
very full and outside off stump, tries to steer through point but the ball is cut off
banged in at the top of the batsman's block, swing a miss - wide on height

comes forward again, hits through the line... but it's not going to clear long-on! Simmons misses out on a half-century and South Africa tighten their grip. Cleared the front leg and was looking to hit this into the crowd but Wiese had bowled a leg cutter, it held up a bit and flew straight to the fielder on the rope
pushed through on a length outside off, punched through point for a single
another good change of pace from Wiese, beats Fletcher's prod as he stands in the crease
starts with a leg-side half-tracker, Bravo doesn't need to hit those
flamboyant square drive from Bravo, sitting back and flaying a length ball through point, but there's a man out there
short and outside off, tucks Fletcher up, maybe a thin bottom edge but it bounces in front of van Wyk

backs away and carves a big outside edge down to third man - Parnell strikes! Desultory from Fletcher, didn't know where he was going to get runs and just had a hack, then ran into Parnell in his follow through, too
goes back and defends from the crease around off stump
better line from Parnell, back of a length and getting some shape, beats the bat on the inside and flicks the pad on the way through to van Wyk
short and at the body, Bravo drops right back and nudges it away behind square for one
around the wicket, pushed across the right-hander, tapped into the leg side
nice bit of drift from Duminy, floated outside off and skipping through past the outside edge
full and on off stump, Pollard stands tall and pats it back to the bowler
flatter and quicker, pushed back on the off side, they trundle through for the single
length delivery, worked off the pads to deep midwicket for a couple, good running
touch short, bounces up on middle stump, Bravo nurdles through square and there's two more as van Wyk gives chase
walks out and tries to dab the ball to the leg side, hit on the front pad
high backlift from Pollard, reaches out to swish a full delivery through midwicket
on the stumps, chopped to the man at backward point
tossed up on off stump, Bravo backs away and cuts into a gap in front of square
flat trajectory from Phangiso, pushed into the covers for another single
full and drifting towards leg stump, flicked away, West Indies still dealing in one and twos
tries to heave over the leg side, was reaching outside off, might have been a slower ball and the connection isn't good, long-on gets around to cut it off

top-edged hiiiiiiiiiiiiiiigggghhhh into the sky, Wiese has another! Bravo was trying to hammer this over the leg side but was done by the lack of pace, hand came off the bat and the ball spiralled up and down into the waiting gloves of van Wyk, who had jogged over to backward square leg
punched back on the off side
full and around the line of off, shuffles across and flicks a single through midwicket
short of a length, over middle and leg, worked off the hip behind square

picks the bouncer and this is crunched into the stands at deep midwicket, hit flat and hard - not enough pace off the surface to trouble Russell but plenty to help send it beyond the rope for a rare WI boundary
goes full and wide, Pollard makes room and belabours a single down the ground
tries to go full and wide but becomes a low full toss, Russell had gone back and he slams a drive through the covers
short this time, swivels and rolls the wrists trough a pull to deep square midwicket
punched forcefully to mid-off, who's set back, Pollard calls for the single but he would have been struggling had Behardien hit
around the wicket, slower-ball bouncer, Russell has stepped away and can only waft at it

length ball, Russell toe-ends this up into the night sky... and Ontong takes a good running catch, almost colliding with Phangiso in the process! Not the best calling there, I think, it was actually harder for Ontong, as he was running back, but he took it well
short and outside off, intelligently played by Sammy, delicately cutting fine for a couple to third man
another short ball, maybe a change of pace, this time Sammy fails to connect
pitched up outside off, Sammy drives firmly through the covers for one
dug in short and Pollard gets into an awkward shape trying to pull, bottom edged through backward square
pitched up on off stump, Sammy smashes it back along the ground to long-off
slightly full of a length, outside off, Pollard can't get under it, one more to long-off
angled in with the arm on the stumps, goes back and chops one into the covers
flighted on off stump, straightening a touch, steered towards point
full length, faster delivery and Pollard can only bunt it along the ground to long-off
gives this a bit more air and Sammy advances menacingly, mistimes a heave into a gap at mid-off
shorter length, pulled through the leg side for one more
tossed up and punched on the half-volley back down the ground - another single, but West Indies needs more than that. They've only scored two boundaries since the Powerplay
slower delivery, sits up but Sammy can only thrash one through the covers
fuller, taking all the pace off it, Pollard swings hard but doesn't time it, the ball dribbles through midwicket

tries to cut but it's too close, top-edged to backward point! That's pretty much a wrap, Wiese has his fourth wicket, best bowling in T20Is. Had to manufacture the power, again the cutter coming back in, miscued to the edge of the circle
goes full and around off stump, manages to flick this away to leg walking across his stumps
worked into the leg side, just one there
length ball on the stumps, Brathwaite spanks it straight to deep midwicket! That's five for Wiese... They've been trying to hit the cover off him all night but still West Indies are none the Wiese
full length outside off, Pollard leans out and dabs
slightly short and outside off, chops the ball hard through point to the sweeper
length outside off, Pollard frees the arms and crunches towards long-off, the fielder has to run to his left, they'll get two
very short from Abbott, miles over the batsman
rolls his fingers over the ball, wide in the channel and Pollard flails at it unsuccessfully
shortish, steps back and clumps down the ground with a horizontal bat, long-on collects
good length on off stump, Nurse plays an attractive-looking on drive for one
slighlty short and in the channel, chops a single into the covers
yorker from de Lange, well directed on off stump but Pollard spots it, nudges a single to midwicket
banged in short, too quick for Nurse, who ducks underneath it
full and straight, tries to get his feet out of the way... and chips to mid-on! He was set to hit down the ground but completely mistimed it, looped the ball up to Duminy
pitched up around off stump, Pollard goes back and steers a single behind square

full and straight, bowled him! The stumps go zing as Cottrell is defeated all ends up, that finishes it off in style - South Africa win by 69 runs and pull back some respectability, losing the series 2-1
